dispatcher module¶

This module is used to ‘dispatch’ or execute a particular schedule file. When the schedule file completes, the dispatcher is finished. This module can be run from command line with an optional argument specifying the path to a schedule file. Alternatively, this module can be run as a multiprocessing.Process and given a multiprocessing.Pipe for communication to other processes.

dispatcher.devicesInRange(startContact, endContact, skip=True)[source]¶

Deprecated function for generating a list of devices.

dispatcher.dispatch(schedule_file_path=None, pipe=None)[source]¶

Given a schedule file path, begin executing the experiments in the schedule file, otherwise prompt the user for a schedule file.

dispatcher.run_file(schedule_file_path, pipe=None)[source]¶

Given a shedule file path, open the file and step through each experiment.

dispatcher.send_notification_via_pushbullet(title, body)[source]¶
